title: wroc_love.rb 2023
description: wroc_love.rb is a Ruby conference organized by the community that aims to confront ideas in a friendly atmosphere.

speakers.name: Agnieszka Małaszkiewicz
speakers.description: Full-stack developer in love with backend written in Ruby aka Woman on Rails. Rails Girls mentor and organizer. Offline dancer and book reader.

speakers.name: Cristian Planas
speakers.description: I am a software engineer currently based in New York City. I have been working primarily with Rails since the release of Rails 3, more than 10 years ago. Performance optimization has been an obsession for me since I founded my first start-up as a solo engineer in 2012. Currently, I am a group tech lead and senior staff engineer at Zendesk, where I focus on performance optimization

speakers.name: Ayush Newatia
speakers.description:
Ayush is a freelance Ruby and Rails developer. He's on the core team of the Bridgetown open source project and the author of The Rails and Hotwire Codex. He also runs a privacy focused mailing list app called Scattergun.
In a previous life, he worked as an iOS and Android developer and was involved with the development of hugely popular apps for companies such as Nike and Dyson.

speakers.name: Scott Bellware
speakers.description: Scott Bellware works with software teams on evented and message-based systems, as well as architecture remediation. He’s been on a ten-year mission to incorporate all the good things he’s learned in the distributed systems world with all the good things he’s learned in the mainstream web app world. He's a software professional with 25 years of industry experience, and has been hands-on in virtually every role in a software organization from developer, to QA, to product manager, to CTO. Scott is a co-founder of the open source Eventide Project and Message DB.

speakers.name: Nathan Ladd
speakers.description: Software developer and consultant hailing from Austin, TX. Often guilty of writing evented microservices in ruby using the Eventide framework, of which he is also a co-author. Also wrote Test Bench, a BDD inspired test framework for ruby. When his focus isn’t improving software systems, his hobbies include RV living, calisthenics, and guitar.

speakers.name: Łukasz Reszke
speakers.description: Uses domain-driven design, event sourcing, and a pragmatic approach to problem solving.

speakers.name: Miron Marczuk
speakers.description: I'm a Senior Ruby Developer with more than 5 years of experience. During my career, I worked on various international projects written in Ruby, including in-house CMS, e-commerce management software, and ML-powered search engine. I spend my free time training triathlon.

speakers.name: Tomasz Donarski
speakers.description: Ruby developer working at Monterail. OSS supporter. Interested in engineering the #### out of problems. Most likely reading about DDD or software architecture at the moment.

speakers.name: Chris Hasiński
speakers.description: A developer with over 15 years of experience. Mainly interested in application performance and code readability, but happy to discuss all things software.

venue.name: University of Wrocław, Institute of Computer Science
